list_definition.definition: (a person) opposed to change and progress or favouring a return to things as they were

list_ex_of_english: Liberals viewed the bureaucracy as a reactionary tool used by governments that were unaccountable to constitutions or the popular will.
The reaction, without being reactionary, was performed by three excellent historians.
Religious reactionaries were not, however, to blame for this breakup.
The opposition becomes simple-minded and reactionary, the past becomes monolithic.
The embarrassing hiatus in the development of the national monument, he insisted, was simply the humiliation of a reactionary clique.
But the system was already under attack by a reactionary opposition.
The cabinet was representative of the most prestigious and reactionary elements in parliament and in society.
Is there a way to reaffirm the value of locality without falling into a reactionary trap of blood and soil?
